status_relay.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 import rospy
3 import message_filters
4 from actionlib_msgs.msg import GoalStatusArray
5 from nav_msgs.msg import Odometry
6 from multi_robot_sim.msg import MultiRobotSimStatus
7 import sys
8 
9 class StatusRelay:
10  def __init__(self,namespace):
11  """StatusRelay
12  This module subscribes to the robot's odometry and move_base status
13  It syncronise the data and published it to the status topic
14  """
15  self.namespace = namespace
16 
17  pose_sub = message_filters.Subscriber("odom",Odometry)
18  status_sub = message_filters.Subscriber("move_base/status", GoalStatusArray)
19 
20  ts = message_filters.ApproximateTimeSynchronizer([pose_sub,status_sub],10,0.1,allow_headerless=True)
21 
22  ts.registerCallback(self.sync_callback)
23 
24  self.status_sender = rospy.Publisher('/status', MultiRobotSimStatus, queue_size = 20)
25 
26  def sync_callback(self,pose,status):
27  """
28  The callback function gets the robot position and status
29  It formats the data to MultiRobotSimStatus.msg and published it to the status topic
30  """
31  status_msg = MultiRobotSimStatus()
32  status_msg.robot_id = self.namespace
33  status_msg.position = pose.pose.pose.position
34  if(len(status.status_list)):
35  status_msg.status = status.status_list[-1].status
36  else:
37  status_msg.status = 0
38 
39  self.status_sender.publish(status_msg)
40 
41 if __name__ == '__main__':
42  # initialize node
43  rospy.init_node('status_relay')
44  rospy.loginfo("Running status relay node")
45 
46  # Get the arguments
47  args = rospy.myargv(argv=sys.argv)
48  if(len(args) != 2):
49  rospy.logwarn('need to define namespace')
50  exit()
51  namespace = args[1]
52  S = StatusRelay(namespace)
53  rospy.spin()
